review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 27, 2021
name: Tara
title: Totally recommend!
review: My kids keep coming back to this to play with it. Sensory stimulator! Endless creativity options. So fun to play with, even as an adult.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 21, 2021
name: Amber olmos
title: Does not glow in the dark.
review: Not sure why, but ours sure does not glow, & the pen was immediately lost. I wish it were connected.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 12, 2021
name: Eva Lozano
title: Fun
review: Cute activity for kids

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 12, 2021
name: Michelle Miller
title: Fun sensory toy
review: Fun sensory toy for everyone!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 27, 2020
name: Boyzoo
title: Some are hard to reset
review: My kids lost interest in this quickly.Some of the pegs are hard to reset as well.It is heavy and seems well made, though.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 24, 2020
name: Eric and Liz Aderhold
title: Pretty nice!
review: My sons (ages 5 and 2½) both like this toy pretty well. It offers a pretty nice sensory experience: it exercises sight, sound, and touch simultaneously while drawing a picture. The stylus pulls the magnetic beads up pretty easily. The first time we opened it some of the beads got stuck in the "up" position and were quite hard to push back down again, but after a couple of times it's much easier to reset the toy to a blank slate again. My older son really likes things that glow in the dark so that aspect did appeal to us, and the case does definitely glow in the dark, but the design they've created is difficult to see when in the dark. Furthermore the blue color doesn't have the most contrast with the silver beads in the light, so it can even be hard to see the design in full light. Still, it's a nice fun toy.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 3, 2020
name: DebraS
title: Great Toy
review: My daughters have had hours of fun with this Magnatab.It is small enough to take for traveling too.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 24, 2020
name: Todd W.
title: Cool toy for Christmas!
review: Really cool toy, really great for small motor skills and imaginative play.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 14, 2020
name: Lehigh History Student
title: Great for sensory feedback
review: All of the Magnatab products provide great sensory feedback while giving kids a unique way to learn or be creative. The glow in the dark model adds the benefit of being the perfect size for taking on trips or slipping into a busy bag. I’m not sure what scenario I’d imagine wanting this product to glow in the dark as it’s quite noisy, so it wouldn’t work well for calm environments like bedtime. We haven’t been able to get much glow so far, but again, I can’t think of a time I’d want it to aside from the novelty.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 13, 2020
name: Nan W.
title: Not Excited
review: Three stars because, I probably would not have purchased it but glad I did order it.The four and two year olds liked it. I guess in the current world of high technology this toy isn’t very exciting.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021
name: Karen
title: Perfect!
review: Great for in the car! Great for every age!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021
name: Julieann Dellibovi
title: Excellent toddler activity
review: We bought this for our three year old to play with at restaurants, car rides, etc. and it’s perfect for that. She can be creative or just mess around pushing the magnet balls back in the holes. It’s compact, has a place for the “pen” which is such a life saver. It is a little noisy, but you don’t notice it when you’re in a restaurant or any other space with noise.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2021
name: Jenna B.
title: So fun
review: Perfect gift

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2021
name: Meredith
title: Danger to kids
review: Everyone in my family from the adults to the kiddos has absolutely loved them & they make fantastic car toys.However, within a month of our purchase one of the metal balls actually fell out of the board. There are twin 20 month olds in the house and I have no way of knowing where that metal ball may be. I most definitely know though that I don’t particularly want one of them to find it an eat.And while everyone has loved it we will unfortunately have to toss it & we will not be replacing it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2021
name: Gail Stracke
title: Returned it!
review: Didn’t glow very well in the dark. Hard to see the beads from the background.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
name: CLTRK
title: Didn't love it.
review: Ehh- not very quiet and didn't really flow. Returned.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
name: Daniel E.
title: Great if you don’t lose the pen
review: Love this toy! Except the pen gets lost immediately and renders it unusable. Would be great if the pen was attached by a string on some way.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
name: Genesis alberto
title: It’s alright I like it!
review: I like this product it really nice I love the popping and it a little to loud and it hard to pop it sometimes I won’t receded for Trypophobia people but over all i think it’s great

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
name: Connie
title: Red Vs Blue?
review: I was torn between whether to get the red or light blue Magnatab, and chose the light blue for the glow in the dark feature. However, it barely glows, so don't choose it for this reason alone. The red has a better contrast between the silver beads and the background color, so visual detail is better. The blue one has a slightly larger size, if that's important to you, but I'm not sure it's enough to justify the price difference, since the glow in the dark feature doesn't work so well. Beyond that, the Magnatab is a great toy. The beads were really hard to push out the first use, but after that they came out easily. The toy is well made, simple to use, and a good "non-electronic" option to entertain bored hands.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2021
name: Taresa M. Warren
title: Amazing for tiny hands that need to keep busy
review: We love this product! Keeps hands busy!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 1, 2023
name: Yeliz Bariskan
title: Great gift for your kid
review: It is a perfect gift for my son. He couldn’t leave it even one sec since we gave it :))) he is obsessed with it. It is also great to be able to practice letters and numbers. We found so many product like this on the internet but this one is really in good quality. I highly recommend it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 30, 2023
name: John
title: Great gift
review: Gift for niece. She loves it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 12, 2023
name: Kindle Customer
title: A little damaged
review: I bought this for my special needs sister since she likes to play with lots of items similar to this, I love the idea and concept of it and she has fun with it but a lot of the magnets are not working the way they are supposed to.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 9, 2022
name: Wicked Maine Mumma
title: Kids love it
review: Kids love it. I do too sometimes but also slightly annoying with all the clicking but I can’t really complain because I play with it too lol

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 16, 2022
name: Sunny
title: Overall good product
review: Very loud and obnoxious

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 26, 2022
name: Melissa McKelvey
title: Best car ride activity!
review: We love this thing! Our daughter uses it everyday in the car! Highly recommend!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 19, 2022
name: Crystal O'Brien
title: Review
review: My return time is up and I just opened product. The balls don’t even come out of the holes to be able to use it for what it’s supposed to be used for. Very disappointed and feel like it was a waste of money. You guys should contact me to either replace or give me a refund.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 15, 2022
name: Emma mccarty
title: Terrible.
review: The little balls are really difficult to push down. I think this toy was defective.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 28, 2022
name: Melissa
title: Love
review: Daughter loves playing with this. Easy to take on the go. Keeps her entertained while at other kids sports practices.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 5, 2022
name: Ted the Merciful
title: Horrible Design, Toy isn't as fun a advertised.
review: Two huge design flaws to this.The pen is loose.It needs to be connected by a string so that it's always with the toy.That is a basic when designing a kids toy.Second the pen tip comes apart.Our 2 year old was able to pull it apart and hand it to us.Great!The toy is moderately fun on it's own but greatly overhyped.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 12, 2020
name: NicbachDVM
title: Great learning tool, not great glow-in-the-dark features
review: We have a few of these and our kids love them (3 and 8). They inspire creative play and help improve tactile response. It makes an annoying clicking noise, so caution if you're sensitive to noise. It's easy to carry and portable, which is great for car rides, etc.The downside here is that it barely glows in the dark. We kept it in bright light for 30 minutes and tried taking it in a dark room, but it barely lit up. Not sure why it doesn't work, but keep that in mind. Otherwise, great creative toy.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 7, 2020
name: Ive
title: Create without messes
review: I like the concept of this drawing board because kids can be creative without mess. Mi kids use it sometimes but they are not too excited about it. It is well made and durable.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 30, 2020
name: Jess O'Hara
title: So much fun!
review: I had never used a magnatab before but these are so cool! I am a play therapist and my husband and I run a clinic with speech and occupational therapy. These are fantastic for handwriting, speech and symbol and letter formation, fine motor work, and sensory integration. You can feel each ball connect with the stylus as you write or draw. This gives a very satisfying sensory feedback. The stylus is a nice shape and is comfortable to use.Ours did have some balls stuck in the “out” position but it was easy to push them back in. My husband has enjoyed playing with this and my 18 month old likes to “erase” it. It reminds me of an etch a sketch from childhood in that you can draw and erase over and over again. Love this magnatab and plan on getting more for our clinic and clients to use!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 9, 2020
name: Omri Ran
title: Glow what?
review: Let me start by saying it's a great toy, my kids really enjoy it and we have the numbers/shapes/letters tracing from the same manufacturer. Other then that, the glow in the dark feature is pointless and very badly executed.We left it for hours under direct light to get it to barley glow in complete dark. You need to hold in a specific angle to actually notice the parts with pop out magnets. Kids lost interest in this feature fairly quickly.Other than that, the new stylus design is better and the build quality is pretty good. Unless you need the bigger size I would rather get the non glow version of the same company.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 8, 2020
name: Alice W.
title: Responsive play
review: The magnatab is a great sensory tool for emerging writers and teaches children through play. It has a sensory response using the stylus while encouraging proper pencil grip, and the magnets respond to the the stylus giving children sensory input and reception. So much fun for little learners and adults, too! A great sensor tool for home and school!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 8, 2020
name: Michael A. Behr
title: Very nice, but...misleading packaging?
review: This is rather difficult for me to review.The product is great.My son loves Magnatabs, but his small travel one recently lost a few balls.This one is much larger, has a nice pen, and the glow in the dark makes it extra fun.I actually like the other one a bit more.I found that the tactile "click" was much less with a lot of these, and some of the balls had more trouble staying in place.Leaving it flat for a few hours in the sun (to charge up the glow in the dark part) resulted in some of the balls falling back into the toy.That could have been due to the heat from the sun.However...based on the image on this website, he thought there would be a dog image on here.I'm not sure if he thought some balls would be a different color or if the dog would be painted on the tablet, or what.Maybe it didn't make sense, but he's four, and this is a product geared towards his age level. And he loves the toy but he keeps asking why there's no dog.(He wanted this one because it had a dog, as opposed to another one that had a house.)In the grand scheme of things, it's very, very minor...but I still would like if they could do something on their packaging to make it more clear.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 3, 2020
name: TerraNeu
title: A fun little board to draw on, and an interesting sensory experience.
review: The media could not be loaded. A fun little board to draw on, and an interesting sensory experience. It does glow in the dark, I just could not get a good photo of it.You can play little games on it.. Practice Writing...or just draw.Best of all, it is engaging and No Batteries are required!It has a magnetic pen that stores in the top. You use it to draw across the holes, and it pulls the balls up.It is fun to draw on, and then you can poke the little balls down. It makes kind of a calming sound.{like popping bubble wrap; but less intense.}It is more of an experience. It can be kind of meditative, like a Buddha board; but with little magnetic balls instead of water.It is sturdy.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 2, 2020
name: LT
title: Great sensory toy!
review: My 5 year old son loves playing on the Magnatab! It's a magnetic toy that works by moving a magnetic stylus over the grid filled with magnetic balls that pop up into each hole. So you can draw shapes and designs on the Magnatab. To erase on the Magnatab you can use your finger to push down on the raised balls or you can hold the stylus horizontally and run it across to push balls down, very easy! I like that this toy is compact and easy to travel with, just don't lose the stylus! The glow-in-the-dark feature did not work very well. We would have to charge it up under a light source of we wanted to see any type of glow. Also glows wears away quickly, because the glow-in-the-dark feature is so disappointing I'm giving it 4 stars. This toy promotes creativity, fine motor skills, and teaches science through the use of magnets. It's a different toy, but every kid I've seen with it has had fun playing with it!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 2, 2020
name: Zeke Lark
title: Fun For Rough Doodling/A Toddler Activity; Largely Inadequate For Letters/Numbers
review: Looking at the product image (the one with a dog drawn nicely on the Magnatab) I had in my mind that this would be a nice little doodle board to draw on.Truth be told, it's relatively hard to get a "fine tuned" image/letters/numbers on the board - the balls are "large" for anything "fine tuned" (think pencil/pen on paper).This is a great toy if you have a small child that just wants to drag the pen across the board to make all the little balls pop up to the top of the board and "draw" a picture, but if you have an aspiring artist, or need to write letters/numbers, this isn't the best choice - letters and numbers will be barely legible, and drawing anything recognizable is rather hard.As far as the "glow in the dark" part of this goes - it's not super glow in the dark.If you shine a very bright light right next to it, it will light up for a few moments, but fades rather quickly (see pictures).

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 31, 2020
name: Betty
title: Lots of funat home or in the car
review: This is engaging for kids as young as four and even adults. It is an Ann-contained mag Eric doodle board and is just plain interesting to play wirh, very nicely designed and a size to fitin totes.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
name: J.Prather
title: Fantastic sensory play for preschoolers
review: This is a fantastic toy for creative and sensory play.Using the stylus, kids draw up the magnetic balls into the holes in order to create pictures, letters or numbers.This glow in the dark model is a bit larger than the regular magnatab.The stylus can click in place, hopefully cutting down on the chances of losing it!Kids love the click sound when the balls come into place, and also love running their hands over the balls to "erase" the screen.This reminds me a bit of the classic etch a sketch toy in it's creative capabilities but adds sensory elements that make this toy a good investment for years to come. I'm not sold on the glow in the dark feature.It's pretty subtle, and I'm not sure it's worth the extra dollars.Still, a great toy for preschoolers.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
name: Parks N' Tech
title: A Fun, Quality Drawing Pad!
review: This Magnatab is a really fun and creative art/learning tool! It works extremely well and even glows in the dark. The magnets are also strong and make it very easy to use and create. There is no fear that any of these magnetic balls will fall out of the device itself.The one end of the "pen" is used to "draw" and the other end is used for "erasing." Both of which are easy to do and erasing can be done very quickly. I love that there is no mess of any kind and this could be great for kids of all ages and even adults as well (like me!).The device itself is made out of plastic and it feels pretty strong and sturdy. There is a slot for the "pen" which helps make it easy to take with you on the go.All in all, I would highly recommend this as a fun/alternative way to draw or even learn - for kids and adults alike!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
name: T. Gaston
title: lots of fun, great item
review: Magnatab Glow-in-The-Dark is a huge hit with the grandkids, their parents and even the grandparents.It is a lot of fun to move the magnets around and make different designs.Everyone loves playing with it and showing their designs to each other.Lots of family fun with this one.I ended up having to get a second one so that both grandkids could have one.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
name: Mr. Furkins' Human
title: Disappointing
review: This is the fourth Magnatab toy that I have reviewed in the past few days.I have to say it is the one I found to be the most disappointing.I thought for sure this was going to be the one my kids would like best, but it's not as nice as the alphabet and number/shapes tablets.The aqua blue color doesn't provide much of a contrast in well lit situations for someone sitting a few feet away from you to see what you drew on this tablet.Even up close there's not a lot of contrast.So given that this is a glow in the dark item, we thought it would be better to test it out in a dark room.I had this tablet sit out in sunlight for most of the day, I placed it under a bright light immediately before taking it into a dark room.For a few seconds it had a glow in the dark look, but the metal balls don't show up well enough in the dark to distinguish what has been drawn on the board.It's actually pretty awful.The glow lasts seconds before it's not able to be seen at all.This has the glow in the dark capability of a crappy glow in the dark happy meal toy that only glowed for a minute or two back in the 80s or 90s.There are products out there that can glow all night now (Mam pacifiers, off brand glow in the dark Nerf darts)so my only conclusion is this company doesn't know that glow in the dark technology has evolved since 1983.If you want a fun glow in the dark toy for your kids to play with, this is not it.If you just want a toy where kids can use a magnetic pen to make little silver balls pop up on the grid to hear the satisfying clicking sounds and then push them back down and start again then this toy will do that for you, but it's not a very fun toy.I'd recommend the Magnatabs with the numbers or letters over this one.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
name: D. Coral
title: Ideal for ages 2 to 3
review: The media could not be loaded. Here’s a video of our 7 year old trying out the Magnatab.He thought it was cool for about 5 minutes and then got bored of it.There are not enough magnetic “pixels” to write his name or any words.Very coarse resolution for such purposes or any kind of detailed artwork.But when I gave it to our 3 year old toddler she loves it!She carries it around with her everywhere she goes.The tactile feel of the little balls popping out and and the sound captures her attention and curiosity to experiment more.She can draw happy faces and shapes on it.So from my experience, whether or not the kid will like it depends on the age range.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
name: ColdBrewLoveJenny
title: Fun, like bubble wrap, but loud.
review: Ok this thing is loud haha. It feels fun like popping bubble wrap but it is legit loud. I let me 3YO go crazy with it and I had to actually tell her to stop because the beads were too loud. She really likes using it though. She likes taking out the pen and putting it back. You can’t really see what you are drawing though. I couldn’t make out letters I wrote or shapes I drew. I think this would be fun for a car ride but it’s a bit too loud for us.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
name: AmandaW
title: Meh, I’d pass on this one.
review: Update 8/24/2020I added one more star bc the kids do enjoy it. My daughter will sit and draw something out and take the time to push all the unwanted needs back down.We homeschool (pre-covid) and I thought this would be a great tool for drawing and pacticing numbers and letters, especially since they sell kits to traces your letters and numbers. I tried to draw a neat, single line letter and number and the magnet is so strong it pulls up random beads from a like or two over. You cannot do it neatly unless you spend a LOT of time going super slow or push the random one back down to make it look neat. If you just want to scribble, this maybe good for a toddler that is building finger/pencil gripping skills, but not as a drawing and writing tool. The last photo I tried to draw a single line up and down, and you can really see where it failed to do so neatly.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2020
name: sheishun
title: Top 10 Toy - Magnatab Glow-in-the-Dark
review: Get ready to update your Top Toys List, the Glow-in-the-Dark Magnatab is a Perfect-10 winner! Everything about this toy is ideal!The Glow Magnatab is beautifully designed, with a calming blue color that glows pleasantly in the dark. The silver magnetic pen and the balls accent nicely, plus the Magnatab logo on the toy is a great touch. There is a sleek holder at the top, from which the magnetic pen can be easily removed and replaced, brilliant design! The large magnetic area of this version is amazing - there are almost 800 balls to create your designs, incredible!Let’s start with the play! Remove the pen, and if there are any magnetic balls raised, you can slide the side of the pen up and down the board to easily push the balls down and clear the board for your new design. You can also push individual balls down with your finger. Begin touching the chosen holes with the pen tip to start designing. You will immediately hear the pleasant “clack” of the magnetic balls pulling into place. Wonderful!Such a great Sensory experience - Visual, Auditory and Fine Motor skills will be activated, plus eye-hand coordination and visual planning - not to mention seemingly endless Super Fun! Highly recommend the Glow-in-the-Dark Magnatab for all ages over three, teens and adults will love it, too.The Magnatab is clearly well-made and durable, I absolutely consider this a lifetime toy, something that will last and be of interest ongoing. Definitely going on my Top Toy list!
